https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/pull/1758

Hi @SuvarnaMeenakshi. Thanks for the fix.
As part of the PR https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/pull/1712, the global_db is loaded for every show command.
Curious why that didn't work
Curious why didn't the unit tests catch this. Was it because of mock APIs.
/azp run
Azure Pipelines successfully started running 1 pipeline(s).

> Hi @SuvarnaMeenakshi. Thanks for the fix.
> As part of the PR #1712, the global_db is loaded for every show command.
> Curious why that didn't work

Thank you for the pointer , as discussed seems like though the top level show cli does a load for global_db, which only works when the command is directly executed. In case of show interfaces or show pfc counters, which in turn invokes a script, the script also would require the global_db to be loaded as it is executed as a stand alone script with a different SonicV2connector/ConfigDBConnector class.

> Curious why didn't the unit tests catch this. Was it because of mock APIs.

Yes , that is right. The unit-test uses mock class which uses sonic-py-swsssdk to mock.
So this issue will not be seen in unit-testing.
@sujinmkang Can you please review?
@alexrallen and @dgsudharsan  it looks ok to me but will wait for Dell to perform more verification and confirm the fix.

> def run_command(cmd, use_shell=False):

Why define a new `run_command` function?

> Refers to: scripts/sonic-kdump-config:43 in [f1d2610](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/commit/f1d26102dde2f08db414ad0ca7f67ca98eb9d05e). [](commit_id = [f1d2610](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/commit/f1d26102dde2f08db414ad0ca7f67ca98eb9d05e), deletion_comment = False)

The `run_command(...)` was created by initial author from `Broadcom` and it will return exit code, list of standard output and list of standard error. 

Do we need remove this `run_command(...)` and reuse the one defined in `cli.py`?

> def run_command(cmd, use_shell=False):

Still applicable.

@neethajohn would like to consult with you on the suggested change. it is a good and informative but should we consider not to show the table in that case and just the note instead? what is the purpose of showing some values when the counter is disabled? in many cases it will not be 0 if was enabled and then disabled so the main question why we need it.
@neethajohn kindly reminder, appreciate your feedback on the above question

> @neethajohn would like to consult with you on the suggested change. it is a good and informative but should we consider not to show the table in that case and just the note instead? what is the purpose of showing some values when the counter is disabled? in many cases it will not be 0 if was enabled and then disabled so the main question why we need it.

I agree with you that showing the table makes no sense when its disabled. Looks like in the current change, we still show the counters along with the warning message.  I am fine either way - leaving it there or removing it as long as the warning is there.

> i suggest to remove the table when it is disabled.

Accepted.
Fix is really easy but creating additional unit test still in progress - faced with some difficulties.
I will add fix and appropriate UT soon

> i suggest to remove the table when it is disabled.

Done
UT also added
@neethajohn kindly reminder to review and approve. this issue is relevant for active release branches.

Done

no unit test added?

I double checked your request and found the following:
1- Currently we don't have any unit test for lldp.
2- "show lldp table" is using the lldpctl script from the lldp package to display lldp entries.
it doesn't use any table from the redis and also we don't have any infrastructure for the lldp unit test to mock the lldpctl.

@lguohan,
do you have any suggestion?
@jleveque kindly reminder to assist with pointers to unit test which can be used for this PR.

> @jleveque kindly reminder to assist with pointers to unit test which can be used for this PR.

You can mock the lines which call other utilities (like https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/blob/bce123c946a348685675a7f399870cce3acee0da/scripts/lldpshow#L84), and return mocked-up output as if it had been returned by the utility. I can't find an example at the moment, but I'm sure there are some in the existing tests.

> > @jleveque kindly reminder to assist with pointers to unit test which can be used for this PR.
> 
> You can mock the lines which call other utilities (like
> 
> https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/blob/bce123c946a348685675a7f399870cce3acee0da/scripts/lldpshow#L84
> 
> ), and return mocked-up output as if it had been returned by the utility. I can't find an example at the moment, but I'm sure there are some in the existing tests.

Added a new test which basically doesn't mock the lldpctl as there is more simple way which is:
1- new functionality was added to the parser method and this is the one we need to test.
2- in the unit test, I'm not calling lldp.get_info() which fill lldp.lldpraw DB with an XML output returned from the get_info() which calling lldpctl script, but I'm setting directlly lldp.lldpraw with the info I need to test.
3- in order to test the parser output, I changed the display_sum() method to return a value instead of printing it to the stdout and that's in order to test this returned value.
